given.text: Gang Su is an energetic and creative student. Likes to think outside the box and is a talented software developer able to bring his ideas to fruition effectively. Really enjoyed having him in the group.
Gang is knowledgeable, skilled in bioinformatics and computer programming, web application development. He is a very effective communicator, and has leadership potential.

items: MotifOrganizer: a scalable model-based motif clustering tool for mammalian genomes
Measurement of Tear Glucose Levels with Amperometric Glucose Biosensor/ Capillary Tube Configuration
Integrated Metabolome and Transcriptome Analysis of the NCI60 dataset.
GSearcher: agile attribute querying for biological networks
GLay: community structure analysis of biological networks
Bayesian EM algorithm for scoring polymorphic deletions from SNP data and application to a common CNV on 8q24.
A web server for transcription factor binding site prediction.
MACO: a gapped-alignment scoring tool for comparing transcription factor binding sites.
clusterMaker: a multi-algorithm clustering plugin for Cytoscape.
First Place Award, Health Policy Case Competition
Third prize, Health Informatics Society Case Competition, sponsored by Northrop Grumman
Best Web/Mobile Technology Award for Entrepreneurial Excellence, China Business Challenge, 2012
Dare to Dream Start-up Grants, Zell Lurie Institute Ross School of Business
Jump Start Start-up Grants, Center for Entrepreneurship
Social Innovation Award, China Business Challenge 2011

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Manager, Data Science & Engineering at Netflix
Head of Data Science at Airbnb (We're hiring!)
